description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

As a member of our DBA team at Kibo, you will be responsible for installing, upgrading, administering, maintaining, and customizing our databases for both analysis and transactional environments. You will work closely with other information systems staff from various departments to support and implement a variety of applications, including the corporate-wide data warehouse environment, internally developed applications, and off-the-shelf software. 

ABOUT KIBO

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Maintain databases daily and implement proactive measures to optimize availability and performance 

  • Document and manage processes, serve as a single point of contact for DB operations, and triage incoming requests 

  • Continuously monitor the data tier for health and capacity, taking corrective actions as needed 

  • Implement configuration control and release management for stored procedures and applications connecting to the databases 

  • Ensure quarterly data retention on all databases is executed according to business rules 

  • Schedule and manage annual activities and maintenance tasks independently  

  • Perform database backups and restores 

  • Rotate on-call shifts for critical event handling 

  • Document processes and procedures for others to perform tasks 

  • Use basic PowerShell, Bash, or Python scripting skills to automate repetitive tasks and processes.
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • 3+ years of DBA experience in a production environment with one or more of the following database systems: MySQL, PostgreSQL, and Microsoft SQL Server 

  • Ability to troubleshoot database related performance issues 

  • Experience developing data management operations. 

  • Previous experience in a Software as a Service 7x24x365 environment including on-call rotation 

  • Production and maintenance of high-quality operational documentation 

  • Open to providing overnight and off-hours support as part of a support team 

  • Ability to function well in a team working independently and with good communication skills 

  • Nimble and adaptable in Database Admin environment 

  • Cloud hosted databases such as AWS, GCS, and Azure 

  • Experience using Linux command line 

BONUS

  • Experience with MongoDB  

  • Familiarity with Monitoring systems such as Grafana, Spotlight, and Kibana a plus 

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and hybrid work setting
  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer holiday
  • Generous health, wellness, benefits, and time away programs
  • Commitment to individual growth and development and opportunity for internal mobility
  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn
  • Company-sponsored events and other activities 
 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

As a DevOps Engineer at Kibo, you will design, implement and maintain infrastructure and tools to support software development and deployment, automate and streamline processes, monitor and troubleshoot production systems, act as a liaison between development and operations teams, manage day-to-day operations, ensure compliance and stay up-to-date with latest technologies to continuously improve team's toolset and processes to deliver high-quality software faster, more efficiently, and more securely. 

ABOUT KIBO

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Design, implement, and maintain infrastructure and tools to support software development and deployment 

  • Collaborate with development teams to understand their needs and ensure they have the necessary resources and support to deliver software quickly and reliably 

  • Automate and streamline infrastructure and application deployment processes 

  • Monitor and troubleshoot production systems, and implement solutions to improve performance and stability 

  • Act as a liaison between development and operations teams, fostering a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement 

  • Manage the day-to-day operations of the development and production environments in the India office 

  • Build and deploy tools to ensure compliance with security and regulatory requirements 

  • Stay up to date with the latest technologies and industry best practices, and continuously improve the team's toolset and processes
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • 3+ years of DevOps experience  

  • Extensive Linux system administration experience 

  • Experience with cloud computing platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure 

  • Experience with Kubernetes and related technologies like Flux, Keel or Argo-CD 

  • Experience with monitoring tools such as Elasticsearch, Prometheus, and Grafana 

  • Python, Bash, Go (or similar scripting language) experience  

  • Experience with configuration and automation tools like Ansible, Jenkins, Terraform, Helm 

  • Strong working knowledge of network fundamentals 

  • Excellent problem-solving skills  

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills 

  • Basic relational database usage and management experience 

  • Availability to be participate in 24x7 on-call rotation under reasonable circumstances 

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and hybrid work setting
  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer holiday
  • Generous health, wellness, benefits, and time away programs
  • Commitment to individual growth and development and opportunity for internal mobility
  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn
  • Company-sponsored events and other activities 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description: DevOps Engineer with Kibo Software, Inc. in Dallas, Texas.  Duties include: Responsible for the technical infrastructure and deployment of various enterprise level multi-tenant SaaS solutions. Primary focus of the position is to ensure the company’s applications stay running while thinking of new ways to improve processes. Direct responsibility for analyzing network and system performance and evaluating new tools and systems. Kibo Software, Inc. is an EOE. To apply for this position, please click on the "Apply" button above.

ABOUT THIS ROLE

As an Engineering Manager at Kibo, you will be responsible for overseeing a team of skilled software engineers and guiding them in designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software solutions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with Kibo objectives, while also fostering a collaborative and positive work environment. Your role will involve implementing best practices and processes to improve team productivity and software development efficiency. Additionally, you will mentor and coach team members, helping them achieve their professional goals and advance their careers. 

ABOUT KIBO

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Foster professional development of team members by providing regular feedback and coaching to support their career growth.
  • Contribute to enhancement of team processes and promote a positive engineering culture that aligns with Kibo core values
  • Participate in the engineering leadership team and provide insights and recommendations for improving the overall engineering strategy and direction
  • Collaborate with team members to create and maintain high-quality software using a variety of technologies such as .NET, Angular, React, and SQL.
  • Ensure that code is simple, well-structured, and thoroughly tested to deliver new features and enhancements to existing services
  • Incorporate cutting-edge technologies, frameworks, and libraries into our software solutions
  • Lead and contribute to code reviews to ensure high-quality software development standards
  • Lead the team in Agile methodologies such as daily scrums, sprint reviews, and code demos
  • Foster collaboration with cross-functional teams throughout the entire product development process, including product management, customers, partners, and other engineering teams
  • Break down complex project requirements into manageable coding tasks and develop effective strategies to achieve them
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • 8+ years of software development experience
  • People management experience, with strong leadership skills.
  • Experience with C#, ASP.Net WebAPI, JavaScript, JS Frameworks (ReactJS, Angular, etc), SQL
  • Knowledge of RESTful web services
  • Passionate about testing and able to write effective unit, system, and integration tests
  • Excellent collaboration skills with clients, other departments, and team members

BONUS

  • Experience with Docker containers and Kubernetes a plus
  • Python and NodeJS experience   

KIBO PERKS

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer day
  • Flexible schedule and time away programs
  • Opportunity for impact, rapid career growth, and intellectual stimulation
  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 
  • Generous health, wellness, and benefit programs, including generous leave policies 
  • Company events and other activities (Holiday parties, Happy hours, Volunteering) 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE 

As a strong accounting leader, you will head Kibo's accounting department as Controller. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the timely monthly close of the General Ledger, consolidation and reporting of financial results, coordination of audits, the establishment and maintenance of accounting policies (including revenue recognition), and the development of efficient and effective processes that support compliance to internal controls. Additionally, you will have responsibility for managing the daily activities and development of a team of Finance and Accounting employees. 

ABOUT KIBO 

At Kibo, we provide the only extensible, unified commerce platform that delivers personalized, omnichannel experiences for shoppers. Our solutions unify the end-to-end commerce experience for B2C and B2B retailers, brands, and businesses.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022.  

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with passion, openness, teamwork, innovation, and accountability. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO 

  • Develop and maintain accounting controls, financial reporting, technical accounting, tax, and annual audit deliverables for the company 

  • Supervise accounting department operations, including General Ledger, AP, AR, Payroll, Tax, and Treasury 

  • Continuously assess and improve month-end close processes to automate, enhance accuracy, and elevate service quality 

  • Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local corporate, payroll, and other applicable taxes and regulations 

  • Produce accurate and timely financial statements that conform to US GAAP standards while adhering to a tight closing calendar and identify any financial areas of concern that warrant investigation and resolution 

  • Manage the daily activities and career growth of team members, including team building, coaching, work review, goal setting, and performance management
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED 

  • 8+ years of accounting experience, with experience in an accounting leadership position 

  • CPA certification 

  • Demonstrate strong and broad accounting experience with the ability to apply GAAP knowledge to business scenarios 

  • Experience working in SaaS and private equity owned environments preferrable  

  • Proficiency using Intacct, Avalara, and other ERP and accounting software  

  • Communicate clearly and effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization 

  • Expertise in managing the entire order-to-cash cycle, with a focus on renewals and collections 

  • Demonstrate a track record of success and timely performance. 

KIBO PERKS 

  • Flexible schedule and time away programs 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer day  

  • Generous health, wellness, and benefit programs, including 401(k) match and pet insurance 

  • Opportunity for impact, rapid career growth, and intellectual stimulation 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 

  • Company events and other activities (Holiday parties, Happy hours, Volunteering) 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

Kibo is looking for a Financial Analyst that will help provide ongoing support for key topics such as results analysis and reporting, profitability and financial trend analysis, analytics and forecasting of key revenue and cost drivers in the business. Kibo offers a fast-paced, challenging and fun environment in which the successful candidate will have the chance to learn and grow in multiple areas of corporate financial planning and analysis.  

ABOUT KIBO

At Kibo, we provide the only extensible, unified commerce platform that delivers personalized, omnichannel experiences for shoppers. Our solutions unify the end-to-end commerce experience for B2C and B2B retailers, brands, and businesses.

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022.

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with passion, openness, teamwork, innovation, and accountability. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us!

WHAT YOU’LL DO

·       Provide financial analysis and support across a variety of areas including revenue and expense budgeting, forecasting and analysis, consolidation and presentation of financial results, and M&A modeling and integration.  

·       Learn and maintain Excel financial models, while consistently finding ways to innovate and reduce time to complete key tasks  

·       Produce frequent reports of financial and key performance indicators including variance analysis and trending reports  

·       Produce monthly and quarterly compliance reports, along with ad-hoc requests 

·       Support the month-end financial close process by analyzing data and providing variance explanations 

·       Support the treasury function with cash forecasting models 

·       Support the finance team with other duties and special projects as needed
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or Business; or equivalent experience. 

·       Finance internship or professional work experience is a plus! 

·       Analytical, accurate, detail-oriented, and a hard-worker willing to learn new skills and work successfully in a fast-paced environment  

·       Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills. Able to communicate and work effectively with stakeholders across multiple business functions  

·       Proficient with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint 

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and hybrid work setting
  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer holiday
  • Generous health, wellness, benefits, and time away programs
  • Commitment to individual growth and development and opportunity for internal mobility
  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn
  • Company-sponsored events and other activities 
 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

As a Recruiter at Kibo, you will find and hire high aptitude Kibonauts across teams for our office in India. Your responsibility will be to manage the full cycle recruitment process, including actively sourcing all the way through offers and hiring, to determine the best fit for the organization. You will be the face of the company to candidates and play a crucial role in building the team for our new office in India. 

ABOUT KIBO

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Lead the full cycle recruiting process from initial contact, to negotiation, to job offer 

  • Identify and source candidates through various channels such as LinkedIn, job boards, and professional networks 

  • Screen and interview candidates to assess their qualifications, cultural fit, and compatibility for the company 

  • Build and maintain relationships with potential candidates, upholding the Kibo candidate experience throughout the recruiting process and into onboarding 

  • Collaborate with hiring managers and other leaders to understand their needs and develop strategies to achieve the highest results 

  • Analyze data and metrics to measure the effectiveness of recruiting efforts and make improvements as needed
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • 5+ years of experience as a full cycle Recruiter in a corporate setting or agency setting 

  • Proven track record of hiring to plan, with expertise in compensation benchmarking, and a record of strong retention rates post offer 

  • Excellent communication, teamwork, and interpersonal skills 

  • Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to treat confidential information with discretion 

  • Experience with candidate sourcing tools, recruiting software (ATS), and recruiting metrics 

BONUS 

  • Experience in SaaS /eCommerce industry 

  • Experience in global and/or multi-national companies 

 

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and hybrid work setting 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer holiday 

  • Generous health, wellness, benefits, and time away programs 

  • Commitment to individual growth and development and opportunity for internal mobility 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 

  • Company-sponsored events and other activities  

 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for leading the design and implementation of our ecommerce/OMS platform in conjunction with the technical architecture of our clients' systems and software. You will work closely with the development team, external stakeholders, and other cross-functional teams to ensure that the architecture is aligned with the business goals and strategic direction of the organization. You will also be responsible for ensuring that the architecture is scalable, maintainable, and secure. 

ABOUT KIBO

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Lead thorough design, development, and configuration endeavors for Commerce/ Retail (eCommerce and Order Management) applications 

  • Collaborate, design, and development Kibo solutions that align project requirements and client business objectives  

  • Lead technical and business discussions internally and externally to provide guidance and support to cross-functional teams throughout project lifecycle 

  • Counsel Project Management teams in project planning, milestones, go-live/solution rollouts, and risk identification/mitigation to ensure deliverables are high quality and timely 

  • Guide internal and external stakeholders through Commerce implementation and upgrade projects 

  • Evaluate new technologies and trends and make recommendations to guide customers and project teams through Commerce/Retail projects and implementations 

  • Develop and maintain best practices documentation and reusable frameworks to expedite project execution 

  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex functional, deployment, or systemic issues with enterprise software applications and custom solutions 

  • Support UAT, QA and Performance testing initiatives to meet functional and non-functional requirements
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • 8+ years of experience in implementation of Commerce/Retail software solutions, with proven track record of delivering projects on time and in budget 

  • Experience in software development with proficiency in Node.JS, TypeScript, and JavaScript 

  • Expertise in enterprise Commerce platforms, including implementation and customization 

  • Deep knowledge of integrating with ERP/Catalog/Inventory and other upstream and downstream systems employed by commerce businesses 

  • Exceptional client-facing skills and ability to build strong relationships with clients at all levels 

  • Strong understanding of scalability, maintainability, and security principles 

  • Familiarity with microservices, containerization, and orchestration, with focus on Commerce applications 

  • Experience with enterprise Commerce technologies

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and hybrid work setting 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer holiday 

  • Generous health, wellness, benefits, and time away programs 

  • Commitment to individual growth and development and opportunity for internal mobility 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 

  • Company-sponsored events and other activities 

 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

 As a Support Engineer Tier 1 at Kibo, you will be the first point of contact for customers seeking assistance with software. You will provide timely and professional customer service through various channels including email, online chat, and support case portal. You will troubleshoot and resolve technical issues, document customer interactions and resolutions, and escalate to senior support and engineering teams as necessary. 

ABOUT KIBO 

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO 

  • Respond to customer inquiries via email, online chat, support case portal in a timely and professional manner 

  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to software and hardware 

  • Document customer interactions and resolutions in Salesforce 

  • Escalate and coordinate with senior support and engineering teams as needed 

  • Continuously improve product knowledge and troubleshooting skills 

  • Participate in reasonable on-call rotation for after-hours support 

  • Follow and improve upon established support processes and procedures 

  • Maintain and update customer account information 

  • Meet or exceed established performance metrics for support interactions.
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • Customer service and/or technical support experience 

  • Experience working with API (REST/SOAP/JS) calls and interpreting response codes  

  • Experience with JavaScript, CSS, HTML, or similar languages preferred 

  • Understanding of data feeds in various file structures (XML, CSV, JSON)  

  • Understanding of relational databases and database queries using SQL  

  • Experience with version control software (GitHub), Jira, Salesforce, or ZenDesk preferred 

  • Excellent written communication skills 

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and time away programs 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer day  

  • Generous health, wellness, and benefit programs, including generous leave policies 

  • Opportunity for impact, rapid career growth, and intellectual stimulation 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 

  • Company events and other activities (Holiday parties, Happy hours, Volunteering) 

 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE 

As a Support Engineer Tier 2 at Kibo, you will be responsible for providing advanced technical support to customers and resolving complex software issues. You will act as a mentor and guide for tier 1 support engineers, collaborate with product development teams to identify and resolve product issues, identify and troubleshoot system-wide issues and coordinate with other teams as necessary. 

ABOUT KIBO 

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO 

  • Respond to and resolve advanced technical issues related to software  

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to tier 1 support engineers 

  • Collaborate with product development teams to identify and resolve product issues 

  • Identify and troubleshoot system-wide issues and coordinate with other teams as necessary 

  • Continuously improve product knowledge and troubleshooting skills 

  • Participate in reasonable on-call rotation for after-hours support 

  • Follow and improve upon established support processes and procedures 

  • Provide feedback to improve the product 

  • Meet or exceed established performance metrics for support interactions 

  • Assists in training and onboarding of new support engineers 

  • Act as a point of escalation for tier 1 support engineers 

  • Create and maintain knowledge base articles and technical documentation 

  • Act as a liaison between customer support and other internal teams 

  • Identify and implement process improvements 

  • Analyze and report on support metrics and trends 

  • Lead and participate in projects to improve the customer support experience
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • Experience in technical support and/or customer service. 

  • Experience with frontend structural code (JavaScript/HTML/CSS) 

  • Understanding of data feeds in various file structures (XML, CSV, JSON) 

  • Understanding of relational databases and database queries using SQL 

  • Experience working with API (REST/SOAP/JS) calls and interpreting response codes 

  • Experience with version control software (GitHub), Jira, Salesforce, or ZenDesk preferred 

  • Experience in Commerce in SaaS technology preferred 

  • Excellent client-facing communication skills 

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and time away programs 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer day  

  • Generous health, wellness, and benefit programs, including generous leave policies 

  • Opportunity for impact, rapid career growth, and intellectual stimulation 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn

description:
ABOUT THIS ROLE

As a Technical Architect, you will be responsible for leading the design and implementation of our ecommerce/OMS platform in conjunction with the technical architecture of our clients' systems and software. You will work closely with the development team, external stakeholders, and other cross-functional teams to ensure that the architecture is aligned with the business goals and strategic direction of the organization. You will also be responsible for ensuring that the architecture is scalable, maintainable, and secure. 

ABOUT KIBO

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022. 

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us! 

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Lead thorough design, development, and configuration endeavors for Commerce/ Retail (eCommerce and Order Management) applications 

  • Collaborate, design, and development Kibo solutions that align project requirements and client business objectives  

  • Lead technical and business discussions internally and externally to provide guidance and support to cross-functional teams throughout project lifecycle 

  • Counsel Project Management teams in project planning, milestones, go-live/solution rollouts, and risk identification/mitigation to ensure deliverables are high quality and timely 

  • Guide internal and external stakeholders through Commerce implementation and upgrade projects 

  • Evaluate new technologies and trends and make recommendations to guide customers and project teams through Commerce/Retail projects and implementations 

  • Develop and maintain best practices documentation and reusable frameworks to expedite project execution 

  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex functional, deployment, or systemic issues with enterprise software applications and custom solutions 

  • Support UAT, QA and Performance testing initiatives to meet functional and non-functional requirements
skills:
WHAT YOU’LL NEED

  • 8+ years of experience in implementation of Commerce/Retail software solutions, with proven track record of delivering projects on time and in budget 

  • Experience in software development with proficiency in Node.JS, TypeScript, and JavaScript 

  • Expertise in enterprise Commerce platforms, including implementation and customization 

  • Deep knowledge of integrating with ERP/Catalog/Inventory and other upstream and downstream systems employed by commerce businesses 

  • Exceptional client-facing skills and ability to build strong relationships with clients at all levels 

  • Strong understanding of scalability, maintainability, and security principles 

  • Familiarity with microservices, containerization, and orchestration, with focus on Commerce applications 

  • Experience with enterprise Commerce technologies

KIBO PERKS

  • Flexible schedule and hybrid work setting 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer holiday 

  • Generous health, wellness, benefits, and time away programs 

  • Commitment to individual growth and development and opportunity for internal mobility 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 

  • Company-sponsored events and other activities 

 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.

jobdeptname: Submit your resume to be considered for future opportunities!
description:
Apply Now

Interested in Kibo but don’t see the right position for you at this time? If you’re interested in what we do and have some amazing skills to offer to add value to our team, we’d love to stay connected with you. We’d love to stay in touch! By submitting your resume and your interests below, we’ll keep you updated on positions that align when they become available down the line! 

Kibo is growing quickly and we’ll keep you updated when the right opportunity comes along. While we can’t follow up on every application, we take hiring seriously and your resume with be carefully reviewed by our team.

Our solutions are designed to power the shopping experience for our clients’ customers – from click to doorstep – and to scale with them as their business grows. 

Please connect with us on LinkedIn and keep an eye on our openings. Thank you again for your interest in Kibo! 

About Kibo 

Kibo Commerce is a composable digital commerce platform for B2C, D2C and B2B organizations who want to simplify the complexity in their businesses and deliver modern customer experiences.  We are the only modular, modern commerce platform that supports experiences spanning eCommerce, Order Management, and Subscriptions.  Merchants like Zwilling, Ace Hardware, Jelly Belly and Francesca’s trust Kibo to bring simplicity and sophistication to commerce operations and deliver experiences that drive value.   

Kibo’s expertise and cutting-edge innovation has been recognized by Forrester, Gartner, Internet Retailer, and TrustRadius, and was cited as the sole Leader in The Forrester Wave: B2C Commerce Solutions, Q2 2022.

By joining Kibo, you will be part of a team of Kibonauts all over the world in a remote-friendly environment. Whether your job is to build, sell, or support Kibo’s commerce solutions, we tackle challenges together with the approach of trust, growth mindset, and customer obsession. If you’re seeking a unique challenge with amazing growth potential, then come work with us!  

Perks 

  • Flexible schedule and time away programs 

  • Paid company holidays and global volunteer day  

  • Generous health, wellness, and benefit programs, including 401(k) match and pet insurance 

  • Opportunity for impact, rapid career growth, and intellectual stimulation 

  • Passionate, high-achieving teammates excited to help you succeed and learn 

  • Company events and other activities (Holiday parties, Happy hours, Volunteering) 

At Kibo we celebrate and support all differences. Kibo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital, disability, and veteran status.
